issue.title: [BUG]: Can't train with data frequency of 30 minutes

labels.name: time_series
labels.description: Topics related to the time series

repository.name: pycaret
repository.description: An open-source, low-code machine learning library in Python

issue.body:
### pycaret version checks

- [X] I have checked that this issue has not already been reported [here](https://github.com/pycaret/pycaret/issues).

- [X] I have confirmed this bug exists on the [latest version](https://github.com/pycaret/pycaret/releases) of pycaret.

- [ ] I have confirmed this bug exists on the develop branch of pycaret (pip install -U git+https://github.com/pycaret/pycaret.git@develop).


### Issue Description

Can't train most models when freq='30T'.

### Reproducible Example

```python
import numpy as np
import pandas as pd
from pycaret.time_series import TSForecastingExperiment

index = pd.date_range(start='2020-10-01 00:00:00', end='2020-10-01 23:30:00', freq='30T')

np.random.seed(5005)

df = pd.DataFrame({
    'index': index,
    'target': np.random.randint(0, 255, index.shape[0], dtype=int),
}).set_index('index')

df

exp = TSForecastingExperiment()

s = exp.setup(
    data=df,
    target='target',
    fh=1,
    fold=3,
    session_id=5005
)

exp.create_model('lr_cds_dt')
```


### Expected Behavior

Model to be trained.

### Actual Results

```python-traceback
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
ValueError                                Traceback (most recent call last)
Input In [1], in <cell line: 26>()
     16 exp = TSForecastingExperiment()
     18 s = exp.setup(
     19     data=df,
     20     target='target',
   (...)
     23     session_id=5005
     24 )
---> 26 exp.create_model('lr_cds_dt')

   1623 """
   1624 This function trains and evaluates the performance of a given estimator
   1625 using cross validation. The output of this function is a score grid with
   (...)

   1714 """

-> 1718 return super().create_model(

   1724     experiment_custom_tags=experiment_custom_tags,

   1727 )

-> 1472 model, model_fit_time, model_results, avgs_dict = self._create_model_with_cv(

--> 445 return self.fit(X, y).transform(X, y)
```

body:
Might be related, but it is coming purely from `_get_duration`. It is not getting the correct X (number of points) when index is of type period index with a frequency like 30T. 

https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/80b0410900dfd03e3b97383a7cbe103ebe3a1703/sktime/forecasting/trend.py#L177

hm, this looks like something that should be in or close to the `ForecastingHorizon` and not in the `TrendForecaster` anyway.

@khrapovs, due to your recent work, would you be aware of a `ForecastingHorizon` feature that could replace this easily?
@ngupta23 @fkiraly PR with the fix is coming...

issue.title: [BUG] Fix duration to int coercion for `pd.tseries.offsets.BaseOffset`

repository.name: sktime
repository.description: A unified framework for machine learning with time series

issue.body:
#### Reference Issues/PRs

Closes #2724 

#### What does this implement/fix? Explain your changes.

Correctly coerce `pd.tseries.offsets.BaseOffset` duration into int. Division by unit interval was missing.

#### PR checklist
<!--
Please go through the checklist below. Please feel free to remove points if they are not applicable.
-->

##### For all contributions
- [X] I've added myself to the [list of contributors](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/.all-contributorsrc).
- [ ] Optionally, I've updated sktime's [CODEOWNERS](https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/blob/main/CODEOWNERS) to receive notifications about future changes to these files.
- [X] I've added unit tests and made sure they pass locally.
- [X] The PR title starts with either [ENH], [DOC] or [BUG] indicating whether the PR topic is related to enhancement, documentation or bug

body: Well, that was both heroic and really quick  thanks!
